content.description: Sit start matched on the incut rail as for "Bedrocker". Pull on and stick the first right-hand crimp before crossing and traversing out right utilizing a set of neat and unique pockets, with a crux move out right to a large pocket before topping out.
content.location: Underneath the end of bridge one and the start of bridge two. This climb starts on the same hold as the V4 "Bedrocker".

content.description:
Stand-start with the left hand on the arete, and the right hand on a gaston located a foot to the right of the arete. Pull on and climb up the arete with a few holds and features on the face before grabbing the lip and topping out. 

 A sit start may be possible at around the same grade or perhaps a grade harder.
content.location: This problem lies underneath the second and the last of the three bridges and can be seen when crossing and looking down and to the right. The clean scooped face is hard to miss. To approach this problem, cross the last bridge then cut right immediately and head down to the shore of the river.

content.description: Gym-style climbing on a set of unique holds. Sit-start matched on an incut rail with a few options for feet. Pull on and move up to a crimp to the right. figure out how to cross over before hitting a few deep incut pockets and trend leftward with a long reach to a sloping pocket. Smack up with the right hand and topout.
content.location: Cross the three bridges and then cut left and veer down a short hill back towards the river. Once the ground levels out, there is an easy approach with no rock scrambling by passing on the right side of a smaller sandstoneÂ block and trekking on some river stones.

content.description: This area of climbing is located underneath the set of consecutive bridges. This area has a few possible first ascents to be had, and a few area classics consisting of "Tollbooth" and "Bedrocker". Some of the problems in this area have already been lost to the climate, causing moss and lichen to regrow.
